summary: The U.S. government plans to spend about $35 billion on foreign assistance programs in 2017, and program evaluations can help assess and improve the results of this spending. However, our review of the six agencies providing the most on foreign aid (shown below) found that about a quarter of their program evaluations in 2015 lacked adequate information on results to inform future programs. We recommended...
title: Foreign Assistance: Agencies Can Improve the Quality and Dissemination of Program Evaluations
